author: rpopma
msg: show error details when configuration is invalid

author: stefan2
msg: In preparation of having a single file containing rev data and indexes,
unify revision_file_t initialization:  Always open the rev file instead
of just initializing it and opening it upon demand.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_fs/rev_file.h
(svn_fs_fs__init_revision_file): Drop.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_fs/rev_file.c
(svn_fs_fs__init_revision_file): Rename to ..
(init_revision_file): .. this as it's no longer an API.
(svn_fs_fs__open_pack_or_rev_file): Update caller.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_fs/cached_data.c
(dbg_log_access): Use "open pack file" instead of plain init
followed by later auto-open.  Update all
references to REV_FILE.
(svn_fs_fs__check_rep): Same.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_fs/index.c
(svn_fs_fs__l2p_get_max_ids): Same.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_fs/verify.c
(compare_l2p_to_p2l_index,
compare_p2l_to_l2p_index): Same.

author: stefan2
msg: In preparation of having a single file containing rev data and indexes,
teach our index data stream to use only a sub-section of a given file.
However, don't expose that ability, yet.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_fs/index.c
(svn_fs_fs__packed_number_stream_t): Add members to select the offset
range that the stream covers.
(packed_stream_read): Limit to the upper end of the stream.
(packed_stream_open): Set the range for the stream data to the full
index file, for now.
(packed_stream_seek,
packed_stream_offset): Use / report stream offsets relative to the
beginning of the stream instead of the under-
lying file.  That will ensure identical content
for the indexes before and after combining
them with the data file.

author: stefan2
msg: Unify svnadmin verify --keep-going check for all FSFS formats.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/svnadmin_tests.py
(verify_keep_going): Corrupt at the beginning of the rep file
instead of appending to it.  We now get
the same error messages for all formats.

author: stefan2
msg: Fix the performance regression of packed vs. non-packed repos in 1.9 if
revprop caching has been disabled.
The 1.9 default "compress packed revprops" added about 1ms CPU delay
before the requested revision properties can be accessed.  With revprop
caching enabled, this easily pays off by not having to read multiple
revprop pack files per shard (10ms each for HDD-backed repos).  Without
revprop caching, disk-cached non-compressed revprops will be faster.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_fs/fs_fs.c
(read_config): Default to not compressing packed revprops.
(write_config): Update FSFS config template to reflect the new /
restored default.
